page.title: 01THE THREE MOSSES.
page.content: THE THREE MOSSES The designated area is to be referred to as the 'Three Mosses' consisting of, at the lower or southern section of the area - Downholland Moss, Barton Moss at the centre and Plex Moss at the top or northern section. This section of land is drained peat moss and used for agriculture. Small coppices of mixed trees afford cover to game birds such as pheasant & partridge which roam freely. The narrow roads usually of the single track variety, are built across the mosses on a causeway type of structure, and are now, due to drainage, several feet above the surrounding land. The remnants of a disused railway track disect the lower eastern and western two sections of this area, part of which is a Nature Reserve.
